Totally amazing burgers and beer!  It's a very fun atmosphere and a joy to go to before a show at the Fillmore.  I plan to come back!
This place is a blast. Love the ice rail to keep your beer cold, but the outdoor space is my favorite part!

One of the best bars in Charlotte. Great beer selection, had corn hole and big chess board out back, all in all a solid bar. And the ice strip on the bar, best.invention.ever I'm surprised I've never seen this before, perfect way to keep your beer at the ideal temperature. If you are going to a show at the Fillmore this is a must for a pre-game spot, hell post game too.

Tuesday two dollar beer night is much cooler than I expected. Every beer there counts for this discount wow! I had five fantastic beers for my first foray into VBGB how awesome! I didn't pay for any of them, even more awesome thanks wonderful drinking buddies!  I'm going to list the beers I liked here, mostly so I can remember them for future purchases. My favorite of the night was a Lost Coast tangerine wheat ale that was deliciously citrusy! Second place goes to the Orange Blossome extra pale ale. Beers 3-5 were also very good but I cannot seem to have remembered anything by that point! Outside they have extra cool games and activities on the patio, oh yeah!  As I was leaving for a late dinner I happened to spot the ice rail. What an ingenious idea to have a cooled platform to keep your beer glass cold! I shall be back next Tuesday and maybe even the Tuesday after that! Yeah that's right be ready to put up with me now that you've gotten me hooked.

Lots of great activities to do--big connect four, big jenga, and corn hole, outdoor beer garden area is great for warm nights--you can bring your pets there, too! Good for groups and hanging out!  Beer is pretty good selection, wings are pretty good. I got the Wango Tango sauce which is a bit spicy.   They've got great pretzels, the grilled cheese comes with bacon and is made with pretzels as the two slices.

Came here while waiting for a show at the Filmore. It's a neat place with a lot of seating/room for everyone. The bar is accessible from inside and outside.   Good selection of beer. The food was pretty okay. I got the boneless chicken bites (meh. Don't get them) but the sweet potato fries were great!

This place was great from the minute we walked until the time we walked out. Service at the bar was quick and easy. They serve 12,17, and a 23oz (I think) sized beers. And they have a really neat ring of ice that goes along the bar to sit your beer on keeping good and cold. They had at least 25 craft beers to choose from and I liked all 3 that I had.  On to the food. First we had the soft pretzel  with beer cheese and let me tell you that was the BEST SOFT PRETZEL I've ever had. There is a place in Philadelphia that visit every time I go just to get this pretzel made by an Amish family. VBGB's was better. 2nd we got the loaded nachos and these left a lot to be desired. We only ate a few and decided we didn't want anymore. I told the bartender we didn't like them and almost immediately the manager came over and apologized. Even refunded the back the money for them without us asking. I was blown away how great they treated us, all because we didn't like the nachos. The manager even gave me a free beer. It's great customer service like this that will keep bringing me back for more. In the end we ordered a black bean burger on a pretzel roll and it was great. If your headed to a concert next door this is the place to visit.

This place is in the NC Music Factory so has plenty of parking across the street next to Mattie's Diner if there is no concert that night. For some reason, i avoid going to this part of town thinking it will be tough to park or something, but it's definitely not the case. Picnic table seating allows space for large groups with the opportunity to actually converse.   Nice selection of beer. The ice rail around the bar is pretty cool and definitely unique. i think this place is a worthy destination to hang out with friends. They do actually have 2 tvs in the bar area now and according to twitter, they intend to get some tvs for the patio. Every day they have certain specials with something for $4, $3, $2, $1. i like it.    i regret not hitting up this place at all during the warmer months. Huge patio with several corn hole boards set up.

Very Cool!  Last night (Tuesday) I took a friend to this place I have been wanting to check out since I read Julia S's Excellent review 6-5-2011   Great design inside and out!  Modern Beer Hall look, "Street" Art on a few walls!  Looks Good!  Really liked the "Ice Bar": You can sit your drinks on it to keep them cool!  Huge outdoor eating/drinking area, with a stage.  The food was good, the service was very good:  Here is my numerical rating: Pretzel (sprocket flying FANTASTIC) 5+, Chips 3.0, Kraut 4.0, Sweet Potato Fries 3.79, Pretzel Bun 3.2, Onion Rings 3.85, The Bratwurst was a HUGE letdown a disappointing 2.75 or less, "Street" Art Very cool 4.9, Service Speed 5+, Accuracy 5,  The girl at the counter told us how to get everything we wanted!!!  You will not get that kind of service modeled in many places!  My concerns other than some of the food:  I did not get a Beer, my friend did and said it was good, though most of the Beer's he wanted to order they had run out of???  We were shocked, mostly because it is early Tuesday evening!  We got the last parking place, so when we walked in we were surprised how small the "crowd was!  My friend said each person must have driven.  I was wondering if some people drove more than one car, because there was little parking left on the street!   Music was Very Good, though now the do have TV, probably a lot of folks like TV, I think it's an unneeded distraction!  This was an enjoyable evening and I would (probably will) return when the weather is cooler.

I attended a welcome party/dinner here, a precursory celebration during a wedding weekend.  Which was pretty rad, so for anyone looking for a more laid back large group lunch/dinner - perhaps you want to consider VBGB?    The sad news, for me at least, is that there isn't much in terms if vegan food options.  However, the quinoa salad is in fact terrific (and I'm fine with consuming my calories in fermented liquid format, thank you very much).  Even if the quinoa wasn't the only item I could eat, I'm confident I would have still inhaled five cups (approximately?  sure felt like it afterwards, whoah) of the stuff.  Thankfully everyone else was busy stuffing their faces with pretzels and beer cheese, sliders, etc., so no one really missed the quinoa . . .   The secluded side room (complete with a one-person restroom!) and patio are was reserved for us, but as the festivities ended, a dozen of us wandered into the large patio area chockfull of game such as Connect Four, cornhole, ping pong etc.  There was a laptop DJ as well and quite a large crowd.    The beers, they are impressive.  But there's also wine for those of us who try to abstain from beer.  I had a few whiskey sours that night as well as they were the "themed drink" named after the now wedded couple's dog.  I'm sure whatever you have a hankering for - VBGB has it.

This place is as cool as it gets in Charlotte, NC. Its a great spot to take people from out of town if you are going with a group of 10+ so they can meet people, play games like corn hole, giant Jenga, life sized chess, connect four, ping pong, etc. It is a great place to start the night off or finish a good night after a concert or dinner in the NC Music Factory.   Lots of good beer on tap! In my opinion( i'm a burger guru) the food is pretty good just not amazing. I have had food that is good and food that is average. My friends have the same opinion so I know its not just me! Usually Friday and Saturday nights they have a DJ spinning a really good mix to contribute to the trendy atmosphere.
Had chicken nugget and sweet tater fries.  Both tasted burnt from something else like you need to change the oil badly!!!

After going to many a show at the NC Music Factory, I was embarrassed to say I had not tried VBGB.  I have finally remedied that and am very glad of it!    To the right of the entrance is the counter where you can place your order for food.  You order, take a number, and move along.  There are all kinds of things on the menu: burgers, pretzels, salads, wings, fried things, brats, and so on.  The prices are extremely reasonable.  If you're going to a show and not trying to break the bank for the evening on food/beverages, this is definitely the place to go.    Once you have your food ordered up, you can either take a seat at one of the long picnic tables and wait or make the wise decision and head on over to the bar to get your beer on.  All the local craft breweries have offerings, and there are other craft brews available from all over the place.  You can order all different sizes, from a 12 ounce cup to a jumbo-sized mug to a pitcher.  If it's busy, I recommend going the pitcher route so you don't have to keep going back and waiting in line.    Once you have your number for your food and your beer situation squared away, you can sit inside or outside.  Plenty of places to park it.  The staff brings the food out to you when it's ready and you're good to go.  The place was packed when we were there, but we had no problem finding a seat and the wait for the food was not bad at all.  This place seems to run pretty smoothly when things are busy, and you can get in and out in 30-45 minutes if you're in a rush to catch the opening act.  The food itself was pretty darn tasty.  I had a chicken brat and the lady went with quinoa salad.  We also got sweet potato fries.  Good stuff, and we spend about 16 bucks for the whole thing!  We will definitely be back!

This is a great place to hang out in the warmer months on their HUGE patio.  They have lots of fun games - cornhole, giant connect four, giant jenga and giant chess.    This place is perfect to meet a group of friends as you don't have to worry about the whole "separate check" issue.  They have a walk up counter to order food so you just place your number right on your table for the food delivery.   Huge walkup bar inside and walkup windows for bar service on the patio.  TONS of beer selections, DUH, it is a "beer garden".  And lots of yummy food options too - don't miss the giant pretzels with beer cheese!   Perfect meeting spot before a concert at the Fillmore!

Such a fun place! They have a pretty large beer selection and a lot of different varieties. The bar food is excellent and there is a TON to do outside on their patio. There's board games, giant Jenga, giant chess, giant connect four, corn hole, and beach volleyball, to name a few.  I was really impressed with their bar inside that has a cooled strip built in to keep your beer cool. What a great idea!!!  I could stay and drink at this place all day :)

I had been to VBGB a couple of times before, but I went twice this past week before going to the amphitheater next door for a concert. VBGB is an awesome place for a party, to meet up with friends, or just to swing by and have a beer or two. An outstanding selection of beer and in different glass or mug sizes as well, so very versatile. There is one large main bar that can also be accessed from outside via a drive-thru like window. There is also a small shack out back that I imagine may only open up in the evenings as a secondary drink location.  I have not had much opportunity to explore their food menu, but have had the Jumbo Gourmet Pretzel on a couple of occasions, and as far as pretzels go, it is to die for along with the provided beer cheese as well.   For entertainment they regularly have live music outside as well as all sorts of gaming options from cornhole to jumbo Connect-4, jumbo Chess, and three or four volleyball courts. Awesome atmosphere. Only problem is that the Music Factory is usually so busy that it can be a hassle to get over there, but I guess that is a good problem to have.
Bar as a whole is great.  I don't want to punish them for me being there on a busy night, but the service really should have been better.  Their tap selection is very good.
Great food, total controlled chaos !!! Love it , a def in the Charlotte music scene!!
This place is awesome.  Great food and awesome beer selection.  Life sized games like connect four and chess.  Plus volleyball, cornhole, and board games.  Great place for a night out with a group.

This is a great place to hangout, chill, socialize, and drink good beer. There's something for everyone at VBGB. Their beer selections are legit and you can't beat the $3 craft beer on Tuesday. This is my favorite place to visit at the music factory by far.

Looooooove the beer selection here, and they are awesome because they will let me sample several before making my selection (I'm picky about beer). Tuesdays are especially awesome when they have great beer specials. Food is good; chicken spinach and feta brat with grilled onions and peppers is delicious as is the quinoa salad! Will definitely be back; it's a favorite.

Not being a huge beer person, a casual observer at most, this place has done nothing but help broaden my horizons about what I do and don't like.  The bartenders are very knowlegdable when I walked up and said, "I drink this, tell me what I would like".  I have tried many of the brews, some amazing, some not to so good to my taste and I am happy that they are patient with trying to find a great beer for me to have. Now onto the food.  YUMMMMMM  Jumbo pretzel with beer cheese has no competition to any other beer place in the area.  I am a vegetarian and they have different options for me to try and are so good to you if you don't like something.  I will be going back, ummmm, Tuesday of course.  Great place for friends, trivia nights on Thursday, they have random games to play (Connect Four and Jenga come to mind, when's the last time you played Jenga?)  I reccommend this place to everyone from the casual drinker like myself to the ultimate beer snob.

Pretty awesome beer garden with lots of fun games. Great selection of food and local beers!!! The staff is also very knowledgable of their beers and there is a different choice of sizes - whether you really thirsty and want to have a good time - there's a whole pitcher or if you just want to relax there's also 12 oz 15 oz etc.   I ordered the daily special with the pretzel bun. Highly suggest getting anything with their pretzel bun and potato chips. Secondly, hope you practice your chess and corn hole because they have a life size chess board and two sets of corn hole spots. I am not good at either especially with some beer in me so I deff need practice the next time I go.   This place has a nice outdoor deck and is great for large groups! See you soon VBGB!
One of my favorite places in Charlotte, would be a 5/5 if they didn't skimp on portions sometimes.

Games.  Friendly staff.  Banksy style art.  Dog friendly patio.  Fantastic food.  BEER.   SO many of the things I like!! Have I really not reviewed this before?!?  I love going to VBGB in the Music Factory. Totally chill place. This is the kind of place that you can go and just hang out with friends, have a beer, play jenga or chess and spend a night. I've come here for a couple of my birthdays but have never really been concerned about having a group unless we were definitely getting dinner. You have to get here early if you want a bench table all to yourself. And, I don't care if you're hungry or not - get the pretzel and beer cheese. I'm not kidding. Does it look like I'm kidding? ORDER IT. If you're at VBGB as you read this review, stop reading, walk over to the food counter (Under the big "EAT" sign) and politely order your pretzel and beer cheese. (You could order a brat too, if you're really hungry).   I'll wait.   See? Don't you feel better? Now you can eat your pretzel, drink your beer and have a lovely night. Good luck in chess, I always play the huge chess board too. Love, Kel.

Beyond LOVE THIS PLACE! Family lived in Charlotte and every time we were in town we had to hit up VBGB! Those soft ptetzels with beer cheese are insane. Tons of great beer choices and staff who know their beers!  And who can beat the cooled bar line. Never seen that before.   I will miss you VBGB as family have moved away. Anytime Im in Charlotte this will be the one place I have to revisit.

This is my favorite place to come to for casual celebrations. Birthdays, engagements, whatever. :)  They have done a great job to make a large place feel cozy by dividing it up into sections. There is an indoor area where the food ordering station also is, as well as an awesome bar with a cold strip that keeps your beer cool even if you order the huge size in the summer. Then out back is a patio and deck with more long tables as well as tons of fun games like oversize connect four, oversize jenga, and of course corn hole. Then, to the side are volley ball courts where there is actual league play on some nights.  The indoor area has a few TVs but I definitely wouldn't call this place a sports bar. It's more of a hang out and spend time with friends type of place. The beer selection is ample and delicious, but they do have wine and hard liquor too.

What a fun place. Great selection of bar food. My party enjoyed many of the beers. Of course, we had to get the soft pretzel - nice and warm and enough to share. Definitely the place to go before seeing a show at the Fillmore (where beers cost $12!!). Staff is very friendly and took time to explain how it worked - no wait staff; you get in line for either the food (& soft drinks) or the bar. They give you a number and then bring food to your table.

So with my time in Charlotte coming to a close, the team has been looking to have team activities which included places where we could have adult beverages outside and play some games. VBGB is just the spot for that given its games (i.e., Ping Pong, volleyball, connect 4, cornhole, etc.), outside patio drinking, good bar food and of course good drinks. This joint has its own parking lot and is fairly large allowing for large groups to come and participate in activities. The bar is stocked with lots of good drinks inclusive of beers, whiskey, etc and the bartenders/waitresses are all super friendly. There is also a counter inside to go in and order some bar food inclusive of wings, tots, burgers, etc.   They have 3 or 4 games of cornhole ready to be uses, two ping pong tables, connect 4, life size chess, etc allowing for all members of the group to participate in any activity you want or just simply eat and drink at tables outside while watching all the action. All of the food items are good with plenty of bar options. Obviously a pub style so definitely great to get large groups so you can get a flavor for multiple different things. The Beer selection is also solid with many different options along with all of the other drink items available for people to order. This is a solid place to hit up with large groups or just if you want an option for all these different activities. Definitely recommend for folks in town.

Really awesome place to visit on the weekends especially. They have food also, the best thing I had there were the tater tot nachos (to die) and the kebabs were pretty good. Potato latkes were yummy also. Beer selection is awesome- all local and on tap. There are a bunch of games etc.
Lots of space you and your friends...monster sized bar and tasty treats equals a place to frequent. Not fussy. But works the casual rustic chic look quite well!

This has always been one of my favorite spots in Charlotte. I came into town on Friday and had about 20 people meet up there and they took great care of us, the GM was super nice and I felt the hospitality and awesome customer service. Food is always yummy and they have an nice big selection of beer. Thank you for taking care of us!

I went here with a group of coworkers and really enjoyed the venue. The atmosphere is very laid back and they have many cool games to play.   The food is reasonably priced. I got the chicken kabobs and quinoa salad. The chicken was a little dry but good value. You get two giant skewers for $8.
What a cool concept this place is. We went with some friends for my husbands birthday and had a blast! Great beers, great food, cool atmosphere. We can't wait to go back!
Food amazing!  Beer good.  Beer prices are a bit rough, but worth it every now and again.  Fun environment as well.

This place is a pretty good contender for becoming an amazing beer garden like the ones in NYC. Jumbo-sized games (chess and Jenga) and spaces to play Cornhole Toss and ping-pong plus an amazing beer selection!  It doesn't seem to attract a huge crowd (I wonder why?), but I think it's a great place to come with a group of friends just wanting to enjoy a chill night out in Charlotte.  Maybe people only gather around here when the weather is warm? Hopefully I'll be able to go again this summer!

VBGB is fun and a great environment for enjoying a beer before a concert with friends at NC Music Factory. They have a great beer selection featuring lots of local and North Carolina breweries and the food is decent enough (could be better in my opinion). I really like the layout of ordering food at the window, they just add it to your tab and bring it out to you. Still hungry after your pretzel, just go order something else! The pretzel is delicious but the beer cheese needs a little work - tastes like some kind of velvetta/American/nacho hybrid - cheddar would be better! Worth getting though, I definitely go for the beer and atmosphere. Lots of seating inside and outside too.

Ahhh VBGB--Long time visitor, first time reviewer.   Better put your craft-beer pants on folks, because this place ain't serving pitchers of Bud Light.   This place is exactly what Charlotte needed, and sits nestled directly in the heart of the Charlotte Music Factory. It's kind of a no-frills atmosphere, where everything is counter service; I think it works well, because whether you're indoors or out, there is always an opening to order a beer.   Also, I think at this point in our city's maturity, unless you have a solid patio/rooftop/outdoor area, you're not quite as cool as everyone else...and wow, does VBGB have an excellent patio. Drinking games abound--ping pong, jenga, cornhole, you name it, they've got it.   This place is also perrrrrrfect for the pre-show beer if you're going to either the Fillmore or the TW Amphitheater. A quick stop in for a Birdsong Higher Ground IPA, NoDa 10 Blocks South, or whatever local beer they've got on tap that night, and you'll get right in the groove prior to the show.   Last but not least, don't underestimate the food! One of those big-ass Pretzels & some beer cheese?---as our friends from NY say, fahgettaboudit!

I have been to VBGB twice now.  Great experience both times!  Super chill atomosphere.  The first visit was wtih a large group.  We had no issues finding a space for all of us inside on a picnic table to watch the game.  We also were going inside and outside a bit to place games out on the patio.  Life size Connect-Four....how cool!  My second visit was with my guy friend.  We just chilled at the bar and enjoyed a couple drafts.  I tried one of the pumpkin beers rimmed with cinnamon and sugar.  Yum!  On this visit I discovered the frozen strip at the bar to keep your beer super cold.  How cool!!!  They have specials every day....called 4,3,2,1.  I think both days the $4 were of the wine variety and the 3&2 were of the beer family, with the 1 including free beer sauce or something.  If you are a Rochester, NY native- THEY HAVE ZWEIGLES HOTDOGS here!  Lol....I couldn't even believe my eyes when I saw it on the menu, not realizing this place had NY roots.  I don't like hot dogs, but I like Zweigles!  They also use Dinosaur BBQ (another Upstate NY gem) products....I love feeling at home while living in (my new home) the Queen City!!!
I can't wait for summer and the beach volleyball courts!
Great rotating beer selection, amazing outdoor area, and good bar food options! My favorite spot in the area, even after a concert in the nearby Fillmore and Amphitheater venues.

I had a quick pint before heading over to Fillmore for Gogol Bordello.  We grabbed some food and enjoyed the BIG pretzel and the black bean burger (I think).  Anyway... good place... I really liked the place on the bar to keep your beer chilled.  Pretty slick.  If I'm ever back in North Carolina... I'd hit this place up.  Seems like a nice place to spend a couple of hours with some friends.
Cool spot and a large "outside" area with several game options.  It's a fun place to hang out if your over near the NC Factory.  If you go, be sure to get the pretzel.  You will thank me later.

Wow! Such a cool, unique spot! At first we thought it was just a bar that also had a kitchen. It was very packed because there was a show at the neighboring uptown amphitheater. You walk in and there's long banquet-style picnic tables to eat and drink at, so it's very communal. Plenty of space to find seating. We got the chicken bratwurst and tater tots with fire sauce. The bratwurst wasn't the greatest but that's most likely because it was chicken... so can't really blame VBGB.. But the tots were delicious. Loved the dipping sauce they came with. Not that spicy, but still flavorful.  Only after we finished eating did we realize they have a HUGE outdoor seating area in the back, complete with about 4-6 sand volleyball courts! Music was pumping through the stereos throughout, everyone's having a good time playing volleyball or the giant jenga and giant connect four, corn hole, and of course an outdoor bar too. It was so cool! I'm so jealous that we don't have anything even close to the vgbg concept in raleigh! This place was packed in a good way. Definitely a fun hangout spot to play, drink, talk, eat, whatever!

They have volleyball courts surrounding the patio which is fun during the warmer months. There are leagues you can play in (sportslinkus.com) or pay $5 to use the courts for pick up. After (or during, I don't judge) your games, you can cool down with some nice craft beers and a delicious black bean (or beef) burger. Or nachos. I love the nachos here. They're smothered in beer cheese, black bean and corn salsa, and fried jalapenos - drool. Anything on a pretzel roll is gonna be bomb too. And, of course, a good ol' pretzel with beer cheese.   They've got a big out door area with your usual cornhole, giant jenga, giant connect 4, and a ping pong table. A stage area for some sweet live tunes. A supplemental outdoor bar that's connected to the main bar inside for convenient beverages. A built in ice bar to keep your drinks chilled. And lots and lots of beer on tap. Oohh, and 4-3-2-1 specials every night of the week!  I would skip the parking lots next to them and just go straight for the big parking lot across the street.

Between 3 and 4 stars...I liked the freshness of the food, beer selection, and the food/kitchen staff were great. Food itself was just average, seating is picnic bench-style (very uncomfortable). This is a "Beer Hall" so if you go with that expectation you won't be disappointed, but we were hoping for something more.

This place is amaaaaazing! Love a great venue which have a lot of different activities. Like huge Jenna pieces, enormous chess board, humongous connect-4, corn hole, and I thought I saw a volleyball net.  Place - Great place for a get together and hanging out with friends.  If you want to find a place where you want to actually do something, other than just mingling and drinking beer - this is the place.  Price - I like to take shots, so the prices are a bit high, I went for the $5 specials.  Venue - I really enjoyed the layout of the place.  Upon entering the establishment, the bar is straight aheade, and you can order your food items to your right.  If you enter through the right back, you will get to the game room section.   Overall, I really enjoyed this place. It's different and fun.

Cool and unique place! There are games for kids to keep them entertained, lots of outdoor seating and beach volleyball courts.  A little something for everyone!  The food is really quite good and reasonably priced.  You order food from a walk-up counter, and then it is brought to your table.  And our food arrived amazingly fast which was great since we had kids with us.  It's a little rough around the edges (some of the picnic tables are sagging, games are getting worn out, etc.) but overall a fun place with great food.  We ordered the caprese salad skewers, quinoa salad, burger, sausage sandwich, pretzel, pulled chicken sandwich, chips and corn salad, chicken bites, etc.  Basically, we ordered the entire menu and it was delicious.  They have limited selection on non-alcholic drinks (no iced tea, or lemonade, etc.) and they should serve some sort of plates with the food as it is usually shared among more than one person.  Other than that, GREAT place!

Have been here several times now and most recently, last weekend.  Very good draft beer selection with relaxing rustic atmosphere.  mainly pub type food.  most of the food I've had including pretzel, brat, burger are well executed.  The wings could be better. Mine were a bit undercooked even after i asked for them "crispy and well done". I was told i could not get them well done?  never heard that before.  overall, a great place to grab a cold beer and bite eat before a show at the music factory.  charlotte needs more places like this!

Buddy and I popped in here prior to a concert at the Fillmore. We were surprised at the large amount of seating, and the giant picnic tables are really awesome. Personally I was excited to see they had Ass Clown Brewery on tap because I had not tried them yet. So I got a pint of that and boy was it good! I paired it with a brat on pretzel roll. The brat itself was very bland, lacking almost any flavor. The pretzel roll it came on was amazing though, very warm and soft. I will probably come again if a band I want to see is playing and ill try something else for food. My friend said his burger was really good.

I'm a big, BIG fan of this place. It's a completely unique experience from all the other bars around Charlotte. First of all, they have a huge patio, volleyball courts, ping pong, corn hole... you could basically stay there all day and have a great time.   The beer selection is great, I've never been there and haven't found something new and different to try. They tend to stick with regional breweries with I like but have some pretty good micro brews from the entire US. Oh, if you are a bud lite person they have that too, though people might look at you funny.   I think one of the best things about this place if that the food is LEGIT. German style plates that are delicious. If it's your first time, you cannot leave without their soft pretzel with beer cheese. I know some girls that would rather go out with this pretzel and beer cheese than their boyfriends... and vice-versa.   Service is ok, one thing that annoys me (when not too busy) is that they take your beer as soon as you finish it.. sometimes even before your last sip... some people just call that a good way to keep your glass full... it's irritating at times.   Whether you're going to the Fillmore or the NC Music Factory to catch a show or just going out for a couple of pints. This is a great place to begin and end your evening...

I like this place. Bar food, picnic tables, and lots of games.   I tried the tots and the latkes. Both very tasty; I think I might have overdone it on the fried food that night.  Park for free in the garage across the street if you want to bar hop. The parking on-site is only if you're staying at VBGB only.

This place has a really great atmosphere for beer n brats. I highly recommend it for a place to drink nice beer with friends.  I'm no beer Snob but the beer tender gave a really good suggestion first go.  My only complaint was the the Sausages were smaller than what i expected for $7.00. Especially considering a "large" order of tater tots was $6.00. Those with smaller appetites or just looking for munchies before a show will love this but a full fledged dinner this won't be.

VBGB has it all: a name the rhymes with heeby-jeeby, a frosty strip of bar to keep your beer cold, a wealth of beer from both local and national microbreweries on tap, 90s music, games out back, and a fabulous array of food. And with $2 beers on Tuesday nights, I defy you to find a reason not to go. Ok, the location at the Music Factory may be a little inconvenient, but that is the only negative that I see.  The buttery pretzel is a requirement for anyone visiting, as it complements your beers nicely, as well as come with beer cheese (similar to the orange nacho cheese, but with a beer-twist). Adding further legitimacy, they offer the coarse-grain mustard that is a requirement for anything claiming to be a beer hall. Goes goes perfectly with anything from pretzels to sausages. I was a little less impressed with the sauerkraut, but that may be my spoiled eastern European heritage speaking.  Long wooden communal tables and even a private room make this a great place for hanging out with groups as well. Hope to see you there!
Great food, drinks, and atmosphere! We went here for dinner before our concert and enjoyed it so much we stopped by after the concert too.

I'm consistently impressed by this place.  In no way is it fancy...it's a Beer Garden...but it sure is fun!  First off, VBGB is so easy to work with if you're having a get together.  They will reserve a table if you have a group, let you have the private room...if I could, I would throw every event here.  Second, the food here is GREAT.  I mean, you can't really go wrong with fried food, so that's always good.  I would come here for the Pretzel and cheese.  Best in town by far.  Last night, I tried the Chicken Kabob and the Steak Kabob.  Highly recommend!  It was delicious and a healthy alternative for anyone not interested in the fried food.  I didn't partake in "Taco Tuesday", but maybe next time.  Third, the staff is always so friendly.  They are great about giving recommendations and tastes, and there is always someone walking around picking up empty food trays.  If you're looking for just a good fun place with some great people watching, and you just want to have a beer and snack, this is the place to go.  Awesome before a concert, too, so you can just walk over.  Next time, I'm going to hit up the Giant Connect Four game.

I am at a loss for words starting this review. Ever since I first went there, all I can think of is going back. It's like that pretty girl you see on the subway - you keep hoping and waiting to see her again. A hole in the wall? Maybe.  A dive bar? Not really. A super chill place to meet your friends for great Craft Beer and freakin' awesome eats? Yes, that's more like it.  The atmosphere is so cool it hangs like a cloud. Love the communal tables. Love the draft selection. Love how the restaurant side is like a separate/self-serve type. Beer Cheese Nachos are great any time of day - I would eat them for breakfast. You can really taste the beer in that wonderful pool of nacho cheese at the bottom of the basket. Oh yeah! The chicken skewers were cooked to order - the chicken was ridiculously tender, juicy and flavorful! The person next to me had a giant gourmet pretzel glistening with butter - if she ever got up to go to the bathroom; I had a master plan to eat it!  If your abs are ripped and you like to sweat there's a volleyball court. If you like the outdoors, there's a patio section.   This place has it all. The only thing missing is me, and chances are I'll be there later!
Great place for a group of people, especially in the summer. Food is good, wash it down with the Brooklyn!

Easily one of the most unique places to hang out. The food was amazing ( I had the Black Bean burger) and they have a slew of board games as well as more active games, such as a life-size Connect Four. Highly relaxed environment for families and groups.

It didn't really get me all hyped and excited.  The first and only time I have visited this place was with a work function.  Seemed like a regular bar on a Sunday night.  Their wings were a little different since they were grilled and you don't see that too often.  The thing that I fell in love with was the fact that they have either 32 or 34 oz glasses for their beer.  I can't remember exactly which.  They have games outside and plenty of space.  They also have a nice selection of beer so there is definitely something for everyone.

Big biergarten with a ton of local craft beer on tap. They have table Jenga, giant Connect Four, cornhole, board games, and sand volleyball. You can spend an entire day here doing different activities and trying new types of beer. Their food is surprisingly really good too - my favorite thing to get is the tater tots with fire sauce which is seriously addicting. I personally have found it difficult to meet new people in Charlotte but the games they offer actually make it easy to introduce yourself or invite new people to play with you. The whole vibe at VBGB is just really fun and relaxing- everyone goes there to have fun without any pretenses. It is kid/dog friendly too! The bartenders have always been friendly and quick, so you never have to wait long to order another beer.   If you're looking for a fun way to spend an afternoon, check out VBGB during the day and then head over to 8.2.0 next door for karaoke, arcade games, a speakeasy, and pizza. Or just stop by VBGB before/after a show at the Fillmore!

One of the more fun bars I've been to on a Tuesday night, and here I am in Charlotte, NC.  A friend met me here for my 1 night in town, and she said she wanted to show me something different rather than a generic bar.  Glad she took me here.  First off, they had a ton of beers on tap and for some reason it was $3 beer night.  I chatted with my bartender for a bit to help choose my first beer, but the 2nd and 3rd beers were all her doing.  I have no idea what I drank but all 3 were good, and my tab was $9 before tax and tip.  I've had single beers before that cost $9.  The rest of place is just awesome if you want to be entertained.  Inside a big bar with World Series of Poker playing on the TV (oh hey, I made that show).  Outside there's a full volleyball court with sand.  WTF!?  Super-sized Connect 4 games.  Board games a plenty.  I played Battleship outside at midnight at a bar drinking a beer.  Pretty sure that's as good as it gets for a Tuesday!

Haven't had food here yet but it's a good place to hang and get some drinks. Was there when a Rob Thomas concert was going on next door and one guy was still scalping tickets at 9:30 which was an hour into Rob's set. Maybe play a game and see if you can get a $1 ticket if you wait long enough.

I was at first a little confused with the no waiter setup but honestly it works.  So you walk in, either grab a picnic table or sit at the bar.  When you get hungry you go order at a window and they will bring your food out to you.  Simple enough and reduces staffing thus reducing pricing for drinks and food in general.  I'm good with that.  They have $4, $3, $2, and $1 specials every day and specifically on Tuesday they have $2 pint beers.  You just can't beat that.  I'll be more excited to visit during the summer as the patio looks to be fantastic.

We had so much fun!   Great spot with some awesome beer selection and plenty of space to hang out with friends.   The outdoor patio areas has long tables perfect for a large group or communal dining. It is surrounded my ping pong tables and several beach volleyball courts (which you can reserve for use in pick up games).   We had char grilled wings, which were a little too charred for my taste but I think that one is on me.   Planning on going back this Thursday for trivia night!

What can I say that hasn't been said? Great beer, great specials, fun venue (giant jenga, connect four, outdoor patio seating, sand volleyball...), great staff, and an amazing soft pretzel with beer stone ground mustard sauce. I am probably going to be a regular for drinks at this joint.

One of my hands down favorite places in Charlotte. Great food, great beer, great service. You must try the pulled chicken sandwich with dinosaur sauce and of course the famous pretzels with beer cheese. Wether you feel like sitting inside or outside you're bound to have a wonderful time. They've got life sized chess, connect four, jenga, plus a massive patio and volleyball courts outside. It's all around an awesome experience!

My first experience at VBGB was actually a "girls night out" event where we started the night at the Music Factory there.  Right off the bat, the vibe was very cool, laid back and fun.  I've been there several times since (definitely a great place to pre-game before a concert) and even threw one of my best friends' birthday parties in the private room they have (RESERVE IT---FOR FREE!!!!)    Besides the fact that they have an amazing assortment of beers (Tuesdays $2 drafts-an incredible deal!) AND fantastic food (the pretzel hot dog and beer cheese thought makes my mouth water as I'm typing), they also have a very knowledgeable and friendly staff and a ton of cool bar games!  Giant Jenga, Connect Four, cornhole....You cannot possibly get bored here!  I'm heading there tonight for Trivia at 8:30 and am sure I won't be disappointed.
Good selection of beers, great pretzels, fun environment.  Would be a good place to go back to when in town.  Bar, not a restaurant.

I had my graduation party here and they were incredible to work with. We ordered a few different food trays and they couldn't have been better! Although the space was filled with many different parties, they did a great job of keeping an eye on our needs and keeping our area sectioned off. The wide array of great beers was also fantastic!

Prior to going to a concert at the Fillmore we stopped into VGBG's for dinner and drinks. We are glad we did the burgers were awesome and their choice of local breweries on tap was more than enough. Their staff were very knowledgable and helpful. We will definitely be back!

Been here a few times. The beer selection is awesome and the indoor bar area is super cool with a self-cooling area to keep your beer cold. The food is good too. The outdoor area is huge and has a bunch of games like giant Jenga and there are outdoor sand volley ball courts.   I recently attended a private work social event here. We had the entire patio for our group and there was a buffet line catered by VBGB. It was a GREAT spot for a big group! Everyone got two beer tickets and the pretzels with cheese dip were to die for.   Definitely recommend for just a quick drink, a small group get together, or for a big group event!

Dear VBGB,  My bad, yo! While I was off over here thinking you were some college idiot infested bar, you're just hanging out at the NC Music Factory with your ample free parking, beautiful pitchers of beer, lots of taps, in a variety of beer styles, being a chill and relaxed destination right outside of Uptown. I'm sorry I assumed some things about you that weren't true - and you know assuming gets ya - it makes an ASS out of ME (and not really U).  But seriously, your outdoor patio with adult Jenga and cornhole was really fun! The indoor/outdoor convenience of ordering, the long picnic tables that encourages people to talk to their neighbors/old friends/new friends and the DJ's on Saturday night was all really enjoyable. I didn't eat any of your food, but next time! We are definitely planning on coming back and hanging out with you soon - perhaps for another birthday party, maybe for a fun date, or a girl's night. No matter the occasion, I think you'd fit the bill pretty well!  Thanks again for the fun night and good beers - may I never judge another nightlife establishment before testing it out again!  Sincerely, Rachel

I came here on a Saturday night, during no special event other than a brave group of people sat in my line of vision and decided to play a round of jumbo jenga. I was immediately roped in and gave a shout of cheer when it fell so I could take the wheel of my own thoughts again.   I wasn't impressed with my choice of beer, Dogfish Head's Black&Red stout.. The flavor profile threw me way out of my orbit but I was a tropper and then the Catawba Valley White Zombie witbier brought me down to earth. I did think that the local beers should be at most $4, because of the proximity and to encourage ppl to drink local brews.   Note: Don't make the mistake I did. If you order your beer before you go to the bathroom, make sure your co-evening partner takes it off the frozen bar strip.. Otherwise, you may spill your beer all over yourself trying to detach it :)  Good experience, good dj, friendly bar staff, clean bathrooms, and outdoor patio!

I had the pleasure of meeting one of the owners today- Have to say I am intrigued and excited to visit-the business model, philosophy and enthusiasm to bring something unique and special to Charlotte have this stay in mom ready to go out! Thanks for giving me something to look forward too!

Was very excited about trying this place when we first moved to CLT, but what a huge letdown. A great beer selection and spacious patio are about all VBGB has going for it -- not that those are bad things. The food, however, is altogether AWFUL. Greasy pretzels, overcooked bratwurst -- admittedly, I've had the real thing in Munich, so my bar's pretty high. Decent place to meet friends for a beer after work, but make sure you don't come hungry.

Pitcher beer? What?!!  There is more outside seating then inside; but that's no problem for VBGB. They have the mega tent.   They have a beer on tap for everyone and their food is basically, food truck food. Good news it's not bad; but, I would love to see more vegetables!   Basic Burger with beer cheese- the bun was bigger than the hamburger and we split the burger.  I got the smaller half.  I was mad; because, it was a good burger.   Beer cheese nachos- with Jalapeños and sour cream too. Next time no sour cream. I'm not a fan of sour cream, so someone needs to remind me.   It's always a fun time with or without the kids at VBGB! Cheers
Love this place the beer selection is awesome, the vibe is great, and cornhole doesn't hurt either!

Great Beer Selection!  This is a nice place to visit while at the NC Music Factory complex (Time Warner Uptown Amphitheater) The beer selection is very good, the bartenders are very knowledgeable, and are very patient about explaining and suggesting different brews. Be warned though, this is not the place to go to get your cheap drink on before a show at the amphitheater- the beer is a little pricey- No dollar fifty PBR's here~  VBGB is a pretty big place with a nice big bar that has the frozen ice rail to keep your beer cold- nice touch, if you can manage to get a seat at the bar - It was crowded the day we were here for a concert. The bar is in a "W" shape and when you first come in to the place it appears kind of chaotic. You can go to the side of the bar to order a beer, but then you can't see the chalk board menu over the bar...Oh well~  VBGB does have a huge outdoor patio- However it needs some shade!!! It's a wide open space that gets cooking hot during the day!  No critiquing of the food here, didn't get a chance to taste anything. Come to think of it, I didn't really see anybody else partaking of food either...
A quick stop off for a few beers turned out to a drinking fest and calling it an early night as my friend and I drank too much .....that is a good sign VBGB!!!

For what it is, it was good.  It is definitely a beer hall first, and a restaurant second.  The beer and cider and alcohol selection was excellent.  The food was better than most beer halls, but not great. If we weren't coming for a concert, I wouldn't make a special trip to eat or drink here.  But, it was a great option pre-concert (especially since the food inside the Filmore is CRAZY expensive).

This was a great place for both adults and kids on a sunny late afternoon in April.  The beer selection is amazing and the bar staff is helpful and willing to offer samples.  Happy Hour prices were great and they advised me on which size to order to max on the special pricing.  The pretzel was very good but the cheese sauce terrible.  Nachos were also meh.  The burgers, chips and sausage sandwich were very tasty bar food and appropriately priced.  The kids (and adults) loved playing chess, jenga, corn hole and ping pong.  Really fun place, will go back on our next visit to Charlotte. Come for the games and beer, understand that the food is average.

Food is delicious. A slightly gourmet elevation on standard bar fare. The beer selection is handled with a lot of thought and care. Great spot before a show at the Music Factory venues or to catch a Panthers game on TV. Great people great food/drink.

Great spot if you are heading to the NC music Factory for a show.    Great beer selection at a reasonable price.  Got a pitcher of blueberry beer that was delicious!  The bartender was very friendly and attentive and let us taste a few beers before we decided.    They have a chill strip to keep you beverage frosty - sweet!  They have a large side and back porch with table tennis, bag-o boards, and tables with umbrellas.

Hit up VBGB Beer Hall and Garden after a concert at the FIlmore (it's within walking distance). It was a Saturday night, and while the bar wasn't too busy, there were a good amount of people. They have a long L-shaped bar indoors with a nice beer selection (expect nothing less at a beer hall) and liquor. There were also several specials including $6 vodka Redbulls. I didn't eat but they also have German food if you're hungry.   The garden comes alive with a nice outdoor patio with ping pong, plenty of seating, and a tent. There was a DJ out there when I was there which created a little outdoor dance party. Cool place to grab a beer in a chill but fun environment.

Finally came here on a Thursday evening.    Pros: The food selection was great and the set-up of the location was really cool.    Con: The drink selection was just OK, but at least the prices were a-ok to match.    Con: The bartender steered me away from a drink (said it was sour like a grapefruit) that I ended up ordering later--it was delicious and sweet like a sangria cider.  Con: It was shockingly cold _inside_ the location.  I can't imagine what it was like in the beer garden area which was really just an enclosed tent (but man did it look cool!).  Pros: Latkes.  Yes.  They have latkes.  With sour cream, but no apple sauce.  And they let me customize my nacho order as I was being difficult about the sauces and jalapenos.    Con: It took much longer for the food to arrive than you would think considering nachos don't need cooking.  Seriously.    Pro: Location was close to our next event which is pretty much why we chose VBGB in the first place.  Location and latkes.    Would I go again?  Yeah.  If I was already going to be in the area and wanted to eat not-Mexican food or if a group insisted.  But I certainly wouldn't go in and of itself unless it was peak beer gardening weather.

Came in w/some fellow QC YE's as we were walking by and already on the verge of heatstroke, so the AC, food action, and cold brews were a welcome reprieve!  It is counter service for food and open seating. They had a Jazz Hands Basket Special since a Jazz Fest was happening next door. I got the spinach, feta chicken brat w/kraut, beer cheese & sweet honey bbq w:a side of latkes and had zero regrets!  The bar top is where it's at here! I wish I had thought to ask our bartender's name because he was so on point I wanted to hug him on multiple occasions!   First off, he brought us ice cold waters w/o asking, and even replaced the water when a water swiping ninja walked off w/one our party's H2Os!  He also made a solid beer rec and made my fellow diners some awesome drinks!  I was IN LOVE w/the "ice strip" they had for you to put your beer or drink on to keep it ice cold!   Also, the prices were fairly reasonable, especially considering the location in the Music Factory!

While I wouldn't make a trip to the Music Factory just for VBGB, it is always a solid pre or post stop when your primary destination is the Fillmore or Amphitheater. (Or Comedy Zone or Underground or  an event in that giant, empty lot... You get the drift, I'm sure.)   They have a solid selection of bar grub. The boneless wings, loaded tater tots, and pretzel with beer cheese are the perfect choices to soak up a little alcohol in your belly after a long afternoon or evening of drinking. Queen City Brew Fest, Oktoberfest, Cookies & Crafts -- I'm looking at you! Their beer selection is usually pretty good, too. There's always good choices for me and my IPA loving husband. On occasion, I've had a beer that tastes a little funky. I question the cleanliness of their beer lines.   Lots of seating to hang out at a picnic table or sidle up to the bar, inside and out. While I've never taken advantage of their sand volleyball courts, they do look fun. During big games, they usually set up a projector and big screen. So, a good spot to root on the home team. And, they validate parking in the deck (if you happen to land there instead of one of the free, surface lots) now that greedy ol' AvidXchage is charging $5 to park in "their" Music Factoy. Insert eye roll here.

Came here with family on a Thursday night for trivia and had so much fun! We sat on the tent covered patio portion because that's where the trivia was. Although it was a very cold night the tent was completely closed so it was not unbearably cold inside. They do have a small parking lot but parking was full when we got there so we had to park across the street and walk. Not too far.   My husband and I were not too hungry so we ordered a jumbo pretzel with cheese sauce to split. I added a side of fried jalapeños for $1. The prices here are very good. The pretzel was very good as well. Big and warm with just the right amount of salt. Everything I tried here I really enjoyed. My husband ordered the Kentucky bourbon ale and I had (a couple lol) chocolate peanut butter imperial stouts.   A great time, great food and great beer was had by all. We came in third in trivia and won a gift card! They give the top 3 prizes! Woo hoo! I live in Florida but would definitely come here again on another visit!
Great place to hang out and get beers with friends. Giant games to play. I've only had fried pickles here which were great.

We came here on a Saturday night with some friends who live in Charlotte.  We walked up to where you order food and the friendly cashier helpfully explained the ordering process and gave us a lay of the land.  She suggested two pretzels for the four of us but honestly one would have been plenty for everyone to try it.    The pretzels were HUGE!  They were delicious, piping hot with grill marks and dripping with butter.  The (beer) cheese sauce that accompanied the pretzels was average and had no discernible beer flavor at all.  It just tasted like standard food service issue nacho cheese.  It would be nice to see a mustard option which would be a little truer to the beer garden experience.    For food, we also went with an order of fried pickles.  These also came out piping hot, with a crispy coating around good-size tangy and flavorful pickle slices.  Five yelp stars on those bad boys!  We also got onion rings and sweet potato fries - both were served hot and had good flavor.  After all that I was so full I just split a chicken skewer which was okay but my least favorite item I tried.  The chicken and veggies on the kabobs had decent flavor but were pretty dry.    As for atmosphere, we sat in the tented outside area.  It's the middle of January but it is well-heated and was very comfortable.  Seating is at large communal tables and the place is pretty big.  People all around were having lots of fun playing the various games - giant connect 4, ping pong, giant Jenga, cornhole and board games.  The staff would come by regularly and pick up trash and empty glasses.  There was sort of a club/dance music that got progressively louder as the night went on.    Ordering drinks was easy - you just walk up to the counter and order.  They will keep a tab open for you and also let you sample beers before you commit to a full glass.  The beer list was great!  I got to try an Apricot Saison from Wicked Weed brewery up in Asheville.    All in all, I had a blast here and I would definitely be up for coming back.  I'd love to try some different food items and play the games.  I also thought the frosty bar inside is a really cool idea.  There are a number of pics of it on here already.  My review is for a solid four stars.  I was tempted to go five, but the food wasn't out of the park exceptional and I wish you had a dedicated server so you don't have to go up to various windows to order.

Fun environment with lots of things to do from giant Jenga to trivia on Thursdays. You can also watch people play in the volleyball league. Wide selection of craft beers on draft. Decent food for a bar. Would come here more for the atmosphere.

I finally got to try VBGB last night as one of my friends and I had a party here.    This is really a simple place and if you're looking for some place pretentious, this is NOT the place.  Come in jeans or shorts and you'd fit in just fine.     Inside, there are several long picnic tables.  and a custom bar with a few high bench seats which was pretty cool.  You go up to the middle of the bar and order.  They have several different beer selections and the beer changes frequently so the taps have handwritten labels.  There is a beer menu on the back wall.  I was sampling all the IPAs last night and they were all very tasty.  Note:  This is not a place that sells mainstream beers so if you're looking for Bud or Miller lite, you might want to go elsewhere.   Ordering food is done at another counter.  You place your order and they can link it in with your bar tab.  The soft pretzel is absolutely amazing.  Very soft although a bit salty.  I didn't really care for the beer cheese but at that point, i was well into my 5th beer.  Just grab some mustard for my pretzel and I'm fine!.  I also had the sausage sandwich in the pretzel roll and the german potato salad.   The sauerkraut and onions on the sandwhich were tasty.  The place also has a great patio and for our group it was a place where you could talk when the inside got a little loud.  The patio has several tables and a few adult games:  ping pong, cornhole and a big chess board.    I would definitely come back here just to check out the latest beer selections!

I like a lot of things about this place.  1. It is the only place that I can really stomach in the whole NC music factory complex. I like going here before the comedy zone.  2. If you have friends with kids- this is a great place to go with children during the day. They have a giant chess set and some games. Kids can run around and get away with a lot. I once went here before some sort of Disney kids concert and it was packed with children dodging pints of beer.  3. It is HUGE. This is good if you are meeting up for a birthday or with a large group. This is a pet peeve of mine- only some places can really handle a giant group. This place can handle it.  4. It is corny- but I do love the rip off Banksy art work.  5. The beer selection is solid. There are also non beer choices. It is priced well.  6. POTATO LATKES ARE DELICIOUS. The pretzel and beer cheese is also fantastic. The menu isn't huge, but it is good bar food.  7. If it is too hot- they have covered areas and fans. If it is too cold- they have heaters.   The negative:  WHY OH WHY do you not invest in more plants/flowers? Go to a local nursery or home depot. Blow $500 on plants and it would make a huge transformation. I cannot for the life of me understand why this hasn't happened. They put in a volley ball section- but still- the plants are just sad. Please add more plants. It needs it.

This was a pretty cool place!  They will call the bouncer on you if you start having teeny-tiny snowball fights with the ice.  We played ping-pong for awhile and watched a cornhole game going on.    There were several parties/groups in progress, but the servers and bartenders were very friendly, cheerful and helpful.  We didn't eat any food, but will definitely be back for some summer fun!
Great outdoor area to play ping pong and volleyball. The beer selection is great with plenty of local brews on tap

I first visited VBGB with discount (Half Off-Charlotte), I had a wonderful experience, I even photographed the meal (chicken&Spinch Brat, yum) pototoe cakes were good to me, and for the first time Sunflower Beer and I am not a beer drinking, its light and clean with no after taste...and the bartender and cashier was awsome, since then back I went and tried another brat with sweet pototoes fries.  VBGB have weekly specials, which is great to let you experience tastes without filling the taste in your pocket.  ENJOY ALL

Had such a fun time! We, group of 5, went Thursday night and they had trivia from 8:30 - 11ish and we had a blast!! Everything here was excellent!  Service was amazing, everyone was so attentive and ready to cater to us. The trivia guys (Rave Trivia) were hilarious and it was one of the best trivia nights we've had In Charlotte!   Food was excellent, scarfed down the grilled cheese in like 5 seconds and my husband got delicious looking boneless wings!   Price was decent, to be expected from a bar. Nice selection of beers, plenty of IPAs and ales. They let you sample them before you buy it, so that's pretty nice!   Atmosphere was chill and fun! Lots of board games, giant Jenga, giant connect four and cornhole. We sat on the terrace, which they closed in with a tent, and it was popping!   Definitely coming back here! Even won $10 from Trivia!!

You come for the beer but you'll stay for the games and great food. The beer selection is top notch - many local beers from Birdsong, Triple C, Wicked Weed, and Noda. They usually carry a few of the staples from the local breweries but also have a nice variety of the lesser known brews as well.   I've been here a few times now and have played corn hole, jenga, and connect four. Really fun - especially while having a few beers.  I've still yet to try the chess board and volleyball courts. All games are life sized and easy to play even if you're a newbie.   The food is surprisingly good.  Our table ordered a bunch of food to share and it was all really good.  We ordered the black bean burger, sweet potato fries, chips and salsa, pretzel, Italian sausage, edamame, and potato latkes.  My favorite was probably the black bean burger and the potato latke's. The black bean burger comes on a pretzel bun and is one of the most flavorful veggie burgers I've had. The latkes were surprisingly good and are made with potatoes, onions, and chives. They are fried and come out in the shape of potato chips.   A really great concept for those looking for more than just a bar atmosphere.  I would definitely recommend a visit for anyone looking to have a good time with friends.

Beer good. Oh and they have many, yes they do. Good selections, multiple sizes... Yah, so the frost trough may be described as gimmicky by many, but who cares? It keeps me beer cold, guys!   BEER: No complaints. Though VBGB, if you're listening, I'll tack on another star if you would just let me get a Lambic in something other than a puny flute! (A pitcher would be nice. You know... just in case you decide that this is a marvelous idea.)  Also, they do usually have wine specials, which I've seen people get and be happy with.   FOOD: Haven't experienced too much, but the wings are good, and the sweet potato fries are great filler.  SERVICE: Great! Lovely conversation, prompt service. Definitely a high point of this place.  ATMOSPHERE: It definitely feels like a beer hall, and I like it. Beautiful murals. Great layout, very relaxed. Only complaint is that the benches could be a lot closer to the bar and tables. Not sure how legit this complaint is since I'm short, but it sure as hell is a detriment in my book.   Overall, good hang out and I know I'll be back. Wish they had a little more going on in the specials department, but it's one of three places in Charlotte that I can get my favorite beer, so I'm a bit dependent. Great place to bring friends, that's for sure.

One of my favorite bars in Charlotte. The beer cheese is unrivaled, and the apple cinnamon bites are a delicious secret. Great beer list, dog and kid friendly. Great place to go with a big group where everyone can order their food and drinks individually.

This is one of my favorite bars in Charlotte. Their website boasts no Friday cover ever, but I have never known them to charge a cover (and I prickle at the practice of paying just to drink somewhere, especially if there isn't a band).   The best deal they have is on Tuesday night, where almost any of their craft beer drafts are only $3 (let me take a moment to mourn over the fact that they used to only charge $2 on Tuesday). Their beer selection is excellent, and they continually swap out their inventory. This can lead to heartbreak when they no longer carry your favorite beer but makes room for you to discover a new favorite! The bartenders here are excellent and knowledgeable enough to help you navigate what can be an overwhelming selection for a novice beer drinker. They are also happy to hand out samples.   This is also a great location to socialize. They have long tables for big groups, and plenty of board games in addition to life size chess and connect four. They have self serve water towers both inside and outside which is perfect when you need more water but don't want to wait in line at the bar.
This place is SO much fun.  Cheap, but great drinks, amazing food and an eclectic crowd combined with free parking make this my new favorite hangout!

VBGB hosts trivia on Thursday's and it's a total blast! The hosts are funny and the questions are just hard enough that they're fun. I also highly recommend the beer cheese nachos! My favorite was the pretzel bites with beer cheese. The bites were buttery and salty and the beer cheese was heavenly. Can't wait to go back!

We went back again and this time sat outside. We grabbed a drink inside first but the service just wasn't up to par this time. the wait was very long and honestly service wasn't very personable. I asked whether a specific beer was sweet to which he assured me it wasn't.  It was almost sickeningly so (in my opinion), but he ran away so quickly and the line took so long that I just stuck with it..Also, much to my surprise he just assumed I wanted the large size so I was stuck with a bigger amount of it too. The place was busy but I felt like the bartenders had a tough time keeping up with the demand.   Outside looks awesome but there were so many things to do (table tennis, large connect four, large chess, jenga etc.) that it took up the most room and there wasn't very much seating. I wouldn't have really cared about sitting so much but the large mugs are very heavy and it would have been nice to be able to set my drink down every so often. I know it sounds silly but those things were solid!   We recently bought some sort of deal for this place so I am sure we'll be going back and I hope it was more like my first visit than my most recent. Fingers crossed....

Great little beer hall with a good selection of local beers. The food selection isn't too extensive, especially when it comes to stuff on the healthier side, but their grilled chicken and caprese skewers were actually pretty delicious.  Really great outdoor space, but not sure I'd necessarily come here if I had to sit inside. It's a little warehouse-y looking.

One of my favorite bars in Charlotte. They have a constantly changing tap list with good German-style food, There is a huge patio with tons of activities, including corn hole, giant connect four, giant jenga, sand volleyball courts, and numerous other games. They host a great trivia on Thursday as well. This is a great spot for a night out when you're looking to have a good relaxing time with good beer.
Always a good time. Great outdoor area and so much good beer. Don't let summer pass you by without checking VBGB out, friends.

I love a place that you can walk into on a Friday night at 9:30 and see all of the following happening at the same time: Couples getting a late dinner, groups pregaming a show, bros playing cornhole, girls dancing, women singing along to 90s hip hop.   True to form boyfriend and I were starving at 9pm on a Friday and were not looking for fancy. Ended up at VBGB and I am sure glad we did. They already had the music going so it was a little loud for conversation, but we ordered some grub and sat at the bar. They have a great beer selection, obviously. We were able to get a 2016 and 2017 sexual chocolate and compare, which was cool. The bar setup is ideal because its huge but set up in islands so its easy for the bartender to get to you. Its also got an ice covered rail to set your beer on so it will stay cool. Maybe I don't get out much, but never seen this before!   We ordered the boss wings, totchos (how could you not) and a last minute impulse decision of a turkey slider each because they were $2.   Curveball. The turkey slider with cheese and mustard was the best thing. So good. Totchos and wings were also great. We way overordered and couldn't finish everything.   Can't wait to come back in the summer and enjoy the patio! Its the perfect spot for when you halfway wanna go out but don't really want to get ready.

Hey, they have beer! And lots of it! The go-to destination in the Uptown Charlotte region when it comes to the hops, and a wide variety of them to say the least.  Several, and I mean several, beers on tap to choose from and I'm pretty sure they'll have something you will like! If you show up with an empty belly, that is not a problem! VBGB is prepared to handle your hunger with a variety of delicious eats! Just walk up to the window to place your order - they'll track you down based on the numeric flag they assign you. The food comes out in the casual paper boats .. nothing fancy about this place... I like it!  Grab a seat and the bar to chill and chat! Speaking of chilling - don't forget to place your mug on the ice shelf directly in front of you! What a nifty idea. No seat at the bar? Don't worry. There is more than enough space inside and out on the covered patio - which also has window access to order more brews! That's important, gotta keep 'em flowing.  It's a great place to hang out for several hours, or just to grab some pre-concert drinks!

I am not the biggest beer drinker to be found. Not even by size - though I do seem to be getting there. But VBGB makes me want to drink beer, if for no other reason than to play with the awesome ice rail. More places need something like this, whether it is for beer or simply to entertain those with a short attention span.  That alone would not keep you coming back, however. The staff behind the bar is excellent, even for those - like myself - who may not always know what they want, and can help get you pointed in the right direction, happily serving up a sample (or three) to help you along your way.  While there is food to be had, and it isn't the best you will ever find, it's certainly far from the worst. On a good day, you can also partake of the outside fun and games too. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area. Be warned that you might not leave for a while.
Cornhole! Beer, cornhole, beer, cornhole. Beer. Amazing beer selection with an exceptional atmosphere for hanging out with friends and making them. Definitely a must go to!
Went here once and they were busy!! I like the indoor and outdoor seating. Outside has good music and random games to play.
What a great find in Charlotte. Great beers on tap; fun, interesting food that is actually really good! Not a gourmet sit down restaurant but that's ok. Looking for a cool hang out, this is it

Not our kind of place but we had a decent time. We had two hard ciders, a sausage sandwich, chips, onions rings and chicken bites. The food was decent, the ciders were $7 each, the chicken bites were heavily sauced. I wouldn't come out here on purpose but we went to see a concert at The Fillmore so we had time to fill. It was crowded and loud, I'm not a fan of either. You've been warned. They allow customers to bring their dog and be on the patio. It seems like more of a hang out, the waiters keep coming around trying to bus your area to get customers in and out fast.

Had a fantastic time here on 8/29.  Service was too notch, beer selection was great and we ended up ordering a number of items off the menu ~ not a single dish disappointed.  Will visit again in short order!

We really enjoyed VBGB's!  When you walk in there are two windows to right of the place to order your food. You are given a number and they bring you your order. Then you can order your drinks at the huge, beautiful bar (which has an ice shelf!).  I was expecting more of a sit-down type restaurant but this place was still pretty awesome.   It has a great vibe, quick and friendly service, not overly crowded, and the food is really good! We ordered the giant pretzel- the beer cheese is really good! I had the pork brat on the roll. I really enjoyed it, the roll was soft and not too hard or crunchy, like at some places.  My husband had the buffalo chicken tacos which were spicy and delicious.  Our friends ordered the fried pickle appetizer- they was really good too! They were chip not spear style.  The pickles had a light, crispy batter and had a bit of spice.   I loved the ambiance of the place too, with hip music and decor. I love the overhead string lights as well.  This place was more biergarten-ish than I was expecting. They also have a back patio which could be fun come spring.   I will definitelty be back to VBGB's next time I am in the area!

My friends and I have been coming to this place more recently. We just love the music and the different games they have for us to entertain ourselves. The food is also pretty good, which was surprising because it's a bar.

My favorite part about this place: it's the only spot at the NC Music Factory that I can count on being open every day.   If you come here and can't find something you enjoy, well the problem is you my friend. VBGB has a more than impressive beer selection (including a ton of local brews), great bar food, killer patio, and #allthegames. It's the perfect spot to grab drinks and eats before or after a show at the Amphitheatre/Fillmore/FountainPlaza/Comedy Zone.   Don't like beer? They have a full bar. Don't enjoy bar food? Get a salad. First time ordering food here? You have to go to the kitchen window. Don't go to the bar. Every time I'm here i see someone make that mistake. They now serve lunch on Fridays. I tend to order too much food here. I'm not sure why I feel like I need a pretzel, dog or brat of some sort, and wings.  The beer cheese is delicious.  The patio is massive and loaded picnic tables. You can even reserve a table. It's tented during the cool months. There's a window to order drinks so you don't have to go inside. A ton of things to do- sand volleyball courts, cornhole, oversized games. I always want to play giant chess, but I have no idea how to play chess.   Parking is free. Heads up, you may have to park pretty deep in the lot on concert nights. Also, expect an Uber surge if you try to leave when one of these events end. Plan accordingly.

My first visit to VBGB on Halloween weekend was really outstanding. Despite being a popular night with lots of people out, we had extremely quick bar and food service. The beer selection was, of course, fantastic and both the indoor and outdoor seating areas are quite nice.  The real standout, however, was the nachos we ordered. Now, I love nachos of all kinds and it's really hard to go wrong with nachos. But, it's also really difficult to have outstanding nachos. VBGB has done it. I couldn't get enough of their beer nacho cheese and mango salsa and I can't wait to go back just to get their nachos again.

looking for a cool spot at the NC music factory? then definitely check out this bar as I can always count on keeping friends/family entertained! Don't come hungry though, unless your looking for an over priced average meal.   Very similar to Noda's "Blind Pig", VBGB is loaded with tons of entertainment. Some of which include volleyball, giant jenga, and connect four. This is just a few of the many games they have, which is actually very trendy with the bar scenes now days. Another thing I cannot forget to mention, is the large space outside! It is absolutely huge and wraps around the building. Plenty of seating and partially covered in the winter months. Perfect for when your looking for a place to hangout and keep warm.  The bar is great for just about anyone. It is a full bar and they have specials everyday. Furthermore, their selection of beer is fantastic! Most of it is local and reasonably priced. The service is always good and they are well staffed. As for the food, not so great.   I find it very strange when a bar doesn't have french fries! You can find just about any other kind of bar food, but just not that..which is why they received three stars from me. The food itself is ehhh.. okay. Very average. Probably good for someone that is hammered and looking to sober up. I remember a time when I was here with some friends, and we decided to venture uptown when we got hungry, because we all knew how the food was. What a great idea that was.  Parking is free as long as you don't mind walking across the street. you might park pretty far back though, as it is the same parking lot everyone uses at the Music Factory. Also, please note that they do tow! I had a terrible experience with this and would hate for anyone to ever have to go through what I did.

I liked the place.  Food guy wasn't friendly in the least.  Southern hospitality my ass.  Must be working there to save up some money to get the stick removed from his ass.  My sausage was overcooked and dry.  Onion rings were good, claimed they were breaded in house, and I believe them. Beer selection was good, but too many lackluster local brews.   I liked the beer garden environs a lot.

I love VBGB! I've recently joined a volleyball league, mainly just because they play at the VBGB volleyball courts and it gives me a reason to frequent VBGB even more! The location gives you an "out of the city" feel with both indoor and outdoor seating options.  The beer selection at VBGB is fantastic with great options and if you don't know what you want they offer a very affordable flight so you can sample a few beers. If beer isn't your thing, VBGB also offers a full service bar. If you're hungry, the food menu is also pretty decent too!

I have been here multiple times for multiple different occasions and I've never been let down.  I have hosted corporate party's here for both underage and of age people and had nothing but the best service. Long tables with ample seating. Great beer selection.
